project.teaser: SCALE will enable and facilitate the mass deployment of electric vehicles and the accompanying smart charging infrastructure. To do so, SCALE will systematically assess customer expectations, identifying EV-users’ preferences, existing obstacles and potential incentives to...
project.objective: SCALE will enable and facilitate the mass deployment of electric vehicles and the accompanying smart charging infrastructure. To do so, SCALE will systematically assess customer expectations, identifying EV-users’ preferences, existing obstacles and potential incentives to charge smartly. By this, SCALE ensures co-creation and -optimisation, preparing for an open smart charging & V2X eco-system that equally benefits users, cities & regions, businesses, and society at large. SCALE brings together leading existing research & innovation initiatives and smart charging demonstration testbeds from across Europe forming a unique knowledge & collaboration platform. The consortium builds upon existing technologies, standards, and protocols as much as possible and focuses on research and developments of the missing and/or incomplete elements and links. The 29 project partners and associated organisations have been carefully selected and have all the necessary scientific, practical, and technical expertise to develop, test & validate and exploit smart charging & V2X solutions. Partners cover the entire value chain and comprise of leading European OEMs, DSO/ TSOs, CPOs, e-mobility service providers, public authorities, research & knowledge partners, EV user associations and European networks & multipliers. Multiple SCALE consortium partners are directly involved in EC’s European Alternative Fuels Observatory & other important European e-mobility initiatives (STF, Clean Bus Europe). SCALE creates a critical mass to develop the technological, regulatory, organisational and legal readiness that is needed for a mass-market. SCALE will initiate a Joint European Procurement for V2X chargers based on open standards, run by 5 European cities. The Open V2X Alliance ensures SCALE’s legacy during and after the project’s lifetime.
project.title: SCALE - Smart Charging ALignment for Europe
project.keywords: Smart charging, V2X, interoperability, open protocols, grids, EV drivers & users

article.title: Taking vehicle-to-everything solutions to the next level

result.title: Use case evaluation report
result.description: Part of task 3.2 Per use case, a brief evaluation report is written, indicating whether all planned scenarios were tested. If foreseen activities have not taken place, it is described why and how this is resolved.

result.title: Quality Management Plan
result.description: Management plan to ensure high quality of public project deliverables Produced as part of task 72 the PM will establish efficient management and reporting mechanisms set up a framework for internal communication facilitate exchange among partners and coordinate the production of reports An internetbased collaboration and documentmanagement platform will be set up together with facilities for onlinetelephone conferences

result.title: Usability and user experience assessment
result.description: Result in task 4.5. The methodology and assessment results regarding the use, usability, user acceptance and satisfaction of the end-users will be presented in this deliverable. Usability & user experience study are part of an agile development process of the main user-facing technologies of the project. The user experience study is held during the real-life testing phase (in WP3) with min. 20 users at each demo site.

result.title: Monitoring and demonstration activities report
result.description: Needed data and basic reports to have detailed inputs and be able to calculate the KPI and or feed models. A first version will be available in M24,update & final report at the end. The following information will be collected: measured data (power, frequency, peak power, state of charge, commands (request by external parties),market prices/of-fers and gender disaggregated user preferences, requests as part of task 4.2

result.title: Lessons learnt report
result.description: Part of task 3.3. Per Innovation Cluster, a report containing all lessons learnt is produced containing all lessons derived from implementation of use cases in SCALE. By organizing the use cases in Innovation Clusters, SCALE will enable knowledge exchange across use cases, sites and partners. The lessons learnt will be used as input for Task 3.4 Business case development and WP 5 and thus contribute to research on the scalability potential. Lessons learnt will be further developed in WP6 as one of the main project outcomes to be used by European smart charging & V2X practitioners.

result.title: Tool implemented and tested on at least 1 pilot/city
result.description: The city of Utrecht develops a tool helping cities plan for integrated, shared & private EV mobility and EV charging infrastructure rollout, incl. congestion forecast &management in different environments, enabling interaction with additional energy networks (including heating/cooling, gas). By M28, in task 2.6, a software tool and manual possible to answer city planning and simulation regarding the V2G uptake, the tool will be used to give the planning and model to at least one pilot will be ready.

result.title: Stakeholder analysis report
result.description: Part of Task12 Analysis of challenges barriers and participation motives of stakeholders The results will be taken up in tasks13and 14Elaad will lead this analysis being a neutral party with a good overview of stakeholders

result.title: Report on consumer behaviour
result.description: Report on consumer behaviour, challenges, barriers, incentive schemes, and participation motives of consumers in smart charging and V2X charging. This knowledge will be used to identify the best value propositions to each consumer segment and to develop the user interaction design. This report is part of Task1.1, periodically updated with intermediate reports in M6 and M16.

result.title: Guidelines for a Joint Procurement program
result.description: Part of task 5.4. SCALE will define the framework for a Joint Procurement program with multiple (European) public authorities, while at the same time researching governance, technical, economical, and legal perspectives based on an “action research” approach and lessons learned from the Netherlands Agenda for Charging Infrastructure. Deliverable includes tender specifications for procuring charging infrastructure

result.title: Test/protocol conformity
result.description: Part of task 2.5. All the components will be tested and certified in lab environments and be ready to deliver the V2G services corresponding to the specification. A test plan will be written for each service and innovation cluster covering both happy and un-happy flows together with success criteria on machine-to-machine (protocol) and system level based on the output of Task 2.3.

result.title: Risk analysis
result.description: Part of task 2.1. This document and the update describes the risk analysis of the development and technological point of view together with the mitigation strategies. This output will feed into the project risk assessment. Two risk analysis rounds are envisaged: 1)Month 12 (a priori, with mitigation/alternative solutions) and 2)Month 30 (a posteriori, analysis of actual risks occurred & mitigation strategies applied).

result.title: System model
result.description: Part of simulation in task 5.2. Through grid modelling and power system stability studies this task will provide insight into smart scheduling, local distribution system impact, standards on V2G, delays, grid requirements, ancillary service requirements and frequency stability in the Nordic synchronous area where two of the sites are situated. (optimizing and frequency stability), including data sets from the pilots.

result.title: V2X Alliance Terms of Reference of the network
result.description: Lays out the strategy, management procedures & template for Memorandum of Understanding to formalise the transition from the SCALE Reference Group into the V2X Alliance taken up in task 6.4. SCALE will set up a multi-stakeholder group (Cities/regions, OEMs, grid-operators, end-users, DSOs, CPOs, etc.) to ensure end-user feedback. The European V2X Alliance members will be invited to 3 physical workshops, the Bidirectional City events in Utrecht and 3 online events, benefiting from capacity building (Task 6.5).

result.title: Communication, Dissemination & Exploitation Plan
result.description: A Communication Dissemination and Exploitation Plan CDE will be ready in task 61 by Month 6 and updated halfway through the project It will include CDE objectives with quantifiable KPIs appropriate monitoring tools produced in task 61 M6 with updates in M18

result.title: Report on city needs & challenges in integrated planning for smart charging and V2X services
result.description: Part of Task13 Identification of overarching needs and challenges of cities in integrated planning regulation of mobility energy systems a survey and focus group interviews will be conducted to collect data on needs and challenges of30stakeholders eg city regional planners DSO TSO and added value of V2G and smart charging in different cities

result.title: Report on Energy, Social and Environmental Impact assessment Results and Platform development
result.description: Report part of task 4.3. SCALE will use measurements from T4.2 to assess of energy and social impact of demo activities. Presentation of the backgrounded LCA algorithms, the VERIFY platform and the results for each demo site.

result.title: Capacity Building Plan
result.description: Create a framework for SCALE capacity building programme for European V2X Alliance members to replicate SCALE results within their mobility ecosystem SCALE will conceptualise capacity building activities to empower European V2X Alliance members to bring project outputs into their daily operations Training modalities will include peertopeer exchanges site visits capacity building workshops and publicly available topical fact sheets developed in task 65

result.title: Training material and assessment
result.description: Result of task 4.6. This Deliverable will present the training content that will be prepared, along with its assessment results by selected end-users. At the end of the training, an on-line evaluation of the training programme and material will be performed (by at least 20 selected male and female users and stakeholders, representing all the demo sites) to assess effectiveness of content, material and delivery methods to the community/stakeholders; online feedback will be gathered and the results will be analysed and presented.

result.title: List of hard- and software requirements
result.description: List containing all requirements for the hard and software components used in the smart charging and V2X architecture Building on the smart charging and V2X architecture from task 14 the requirements of the hardand software components design are analysed and outlined in task 15 The results of the analysis provide input to WP2 so that the technological gap between the architecture and the current state of the technology can be determined

result.title: Legal & policy recommendations
result.description: Result of task 5.3. Propositions for legal framework and sustainable business international with national options with regard to at least two pilots and within each innovation cluster. Early on, SCALE partners will liaise with the Commissions DG’S, industry task forces & STF sub-groups on key policy issues, e.g. data availability.

result.title: Update protocol definitions
result.description: Part of task 23 Definition of security specification and privacy specifications This document contains specifications modification to protocols open protocols interactions between softwarehardware components Through workshops with actors detailed functional use case descriptions API designs and payload definitions of the different messages will be defined to deliver a clear scope of work for software development in Task 24andinput for developing test plans for interoperability testing under Task 25

result.title: Standards and protocols gap analysis
result.description: Report of the evolution and remaining gaps in standards and protocols for Smart Charging and V2X in task 5.5. SCALE will build upon results from WP2 and WP3 by following-up and promoting evolution of existing standards and protocols to influence their evolution based on SCALE results and specially to address gaps in existing standards

result.title: SCALE Assessment and Monitoring Framework
result.description: Part of task 41 The task will deliver a plan with a roadmap for assessing performance of Use Cases as defined in WP1 T13 incl impact of the smart charging strategies on the electrical system level Aggregator DSO TSO accounting for predefined SCALE impact areas i demand flexibility ii storage resiliency iii smart energy consumption management iv economic viability v social acceptance including gender differences in acceptance and vi smart urban mobility Assessment plan of the project based on which the demos activities will be realised It will include evaluation parameters metrics tools standards data ontologies

result.title: Business case report
result.description: In task 3.4, closely aligned with WP 5, this task develops min. 2 business cases per Innovation Cluster enabling commercial exploitation & scalability of SCALE’s solutions. Per Innovation Cluster, the business cases are explained in a report.

result.title: Local Communication Plans
result.description: Local communication plan from the project onto the citiesregions these plans will establish a communication strategy for the different pilot sites produced in task 63 Polis will liaise with use case leaders to operationalise local communication plans tailored to each site including appointing a local communication manager per site in line with D61 relate to sitebased enduser training WP3 and prepare materials for local communication in local languages

result.title: Specifications and IT Use-Case definition for V2X services
result.description: Part of task 22 This specification will define the uses cases the supported services and the GUI needed for the end user to be able to participate optimize the workflowdataflows

result.title: V2G product/software
result.description: Part of task 2.4. This entails defining the software architecture, developing the solution and testing its implementation so that it meets the requirements from Task 2.3. The outcome is the different software/hardware components ready to run and interact together with each other and the end-user.

result.title: Smart charging and V2X system architecture
result.description: Part of task1.4. Parameters of smart charging and V2X system architecture applicable to all Innovation Clusters. Throughout the project, the architecture (smart charging / V2X) topology will be adjusted when this proves to be necessary during development in WP2, pilots in WP3, or exploitation potential analysis in WP5.

result.title: SCALE risk register
result.description: Risk assessment contingency are linked to regular project processes SCALE adopts a processoriented approach towards risk reduction incl regular evaluation meetings with stakeholders at local level The report is part of task 73 which will be carried out in close alignment with T21 Risk analysis

result.title: Use Case set-up reports
result.description: In task 31 the physical elements designed in WP 1 and developed in WP 2will be implemented at the pilot sites Per use case the exact charging concept implemented and the scenarios services that will be tested in that use case are described

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - SCALE (SCALE - Smart Charging ALignment for Europe)
result.description: periodic
result.teaser: SCALE is a three-year project (2022-2025) co-funded by the new Horizon Europe Programme with a budget of around 10 million EUR. It aims to advance smart charging infrastructure and facilitate the mass deployment of electric vehicles. The project will reduce uncertainties...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
